message.content:
cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of straggling nodes in distributed computations, which is a common issue in distributed computing. The proposed solution involves rateless fountain coding, which is a technique from information theory and coding theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is a likely sub-category. The paper also involves parallel computing and optimization, which are topics covered in cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). The use of linear algebra and matrix operations suggests cs.SY (Systems and Control) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves machine learning and data mining applications, which are topics covered in cs.LG (Machine Learning).
